name: Sendov's conjecture
rephrased: If a polynomial with complex coefficients has a root very close to the boundary of the unit disk, then there must be a critical point (point where the derivative is zero) very close to that root.
implication_form: If a polynomial f(z) = (z - r1)(z - r2)...(z - rn) (with complex coefficients) has a root at r_i that satisfies |r_i| ≥ 1 - ε (i.e., very close to the unit circle |z| = 1), then there exists a critical point of f(z) within ε of r_i.
